intro: Tibouchina wurdackii, commonly known as the purple false heather, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family and is characterized by its showy, violet to purple flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy texture, and it thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Tibouchina wurdackii is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its vibrant color and compact growth habit. It prefers partial shade to full sun and is relatively drought-tolerant once established.
